free.chess
Class Square

java.lang.Object
  free.chess.Square

public class Square
extends java.lang.Object

Represents a location on a chess board.
This class does not allow creating instances of it, instead it keeps an internal pool of immutable instances that can be obtained via the getInstance(). This means that two Squares are the same only if they reference the same object.

Method Detail

getInstance

public static Square getInstance(int file,
                                 int rank)
Returns an instance of Square representing the given coordinates. Valid values lie in the range [0-7].

Parameters:
file - The file index [0-7].
rank - The rank index [0-7].
Throws:
SquareFormatException - if either the file or rank are out of the valid range.

parseSquare

public static Square parseSquare(java.lang.String square)
Returns an instance of Square representing the given square. The square is specified by a string in the usual chess format that represents a square, for example: "e3".

Parameters:
square - The string representing the location.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given string is not in the expected format or the coordinates are out of the valid range.

getFile

public int getFile()
Returns the file of this Square, a value in the range [0-7].

getRank

public int getRank()
Returns the rank of this Square, a value in the range [0-7].

getFileChar

public char getFileChar()
Returns a character representing the file of this Square. The returned character will be in the range ['a'-'h'].

getRankChar

public char getRankChar()
Returns a character representing the rank of this Square. The returned character will be in the range ['1'-'8'].

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Returns a string representation of the square as is common in chess. For example, for a square with file = 4 and rank = 1 this method will return "e2".

Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object

hashCode

public int hashCode()
Returns the hashCode of this Square.

Overrides:
hashCode in class java.lang.Object

Returns true if this square is the same as the square represented by the given String.
